M'Farland and Gray moved and seconded that the Governor be peti tioned to declare crowa noxious animals within the meaning of the Act, in the Corowa district for a period of two years. Carried. On tho motion of Messrs. BI'Farland and Smyth it was decided to pay a bonus of 2d. for the head of every crow killed after they become noxious animals in the Corowa district. Fxdkration Mkbtiko.— On Tuesday eveniog next a delegate from tho Austra lian Federation Leuo will address the electors on tbe Convention Bill in tho Corowa School of Arts, The chair will be taken at 8 p.m. Cobowa Drip Liad G.M. Coy.— Tbe manager reports Since my last report the No. 2 shaft has been sunk 3ft.; total from surface, 81ft. I have slightly im proved the box in this abaft, and to-day It la working much better, Tho pump is working smoothly; We have had very lUtle increase of water this woek. The inking now is in much coarser drift. A Tbxble Traqedy.— A terrible tra gedy was enacted on Queen's Birthday at Forstor, a town on tho 'northern coast. At mid-day, when almost the whole of the residents were taking part in the Oddfel lows' sports, a half-caste named John Field attacked his wife and his child, aged eight years, with-.a tomahawk. With a few deadly strokes he despatched the wo-

man, and then haviug cruelly slaughtered the child, ho proceeded to cut his bwn throat. While doing so, two half-casto women, who had ust returned from tbo sports, entered Field's camp. As soon as he saw them ho rushed at them with tho tomahawk, though blood was streaming from tbo wound in his throat. The women flod shrieking for assistance, whereupon Field ro-enterod his hut. There ho caught light of hii three-months' old baby, lying in its cot, aud he smashed It over the head with; the tomahawk, Inflicting a wound 1 from which tbe brain protrudes. Though the infant is still alive, there is little hope >, of its recovery. The murderer was see- ured, and all possible aid was given to him and tho infant. He, however, died within ten minutes. The causo assigned for tho murder is jealousy' Field wdh a wheelwright, and only lately arrived from tho Manning. Whilo tho tragedy was taking place, a number of visitors from tho surrouuding district were enjoying themselves at a pic-nic in apddock ad joining the camp, and tho news ureatod a most painful sensation.- '
